list-item.p: The actual number of saliva samples tested was relatively low, so interpretation of the findings with regards to transmission blocking should be undertaken with caution, especially when extrapolating to the field.

p.italic: >> We agree with the reviewer, but we think we were able to have good sampling numbers if we consider that 2 isolates (primate and human) were used and the results are quite similar.

list-item.p: “Pluripotency” is not really an appropriate descriptive term in this context.

p.italic: >> The idea of using the word “Pluripotency” was to describe the ability of Wolbachia to reduce transmission of several different pathogens. If there is no big issue on this, we would prefer to keep it and change Arbovirus to Arboviruses to better illustrate what we wanted.
